page.title: 10Employment.
page.content: 2. Hurdle Making. Mr. Davis was 15 when he started Hurdle making and he likes making hurdles very much. The wood for hurdle making is ash and hazel, while the wood for gates is chestnut. He has now been hurdle making for 70 years. Recently he retired and now is content to potter about in his garden. He told us he used to have a Ford car and it looked like a tin box with four wheels. It has two gears and a pedal, you put your foot on the pedal for first gear and then took your foot off for top gear, it went no faster than 30 miles per hour and the nick name for the car was Tin Lizzie. If you wanted a car it would cost you twenty pounds. His next car was a Morris that had three gears. This cost him One hundred and Twenty pounds, it was much nicer.
